items.question: Do I need to understand blockchain to use Lien commun?
items.answer: No, absolutely not. Lien commun is designed to be as simple as a bank transfer. The blockchain works in the background, you never need to interact with it directly.

items.question: How are donations tracked?
items.answer: Each donation is converted to stablecoin (EUR CoinVertible) and recorded on the Ethereum blockchain. Each association expense is also recorded with a timestamped receipt.

items.question: Do I receive a tax receipt?
items.answer: Yes. Each donation automatically generates a digital tax receipt in the form of an NFT, which you can download or keep in your donor space.

items.question: Which associations can register?
items.answer: Any association registered in the SIRENE directory can register for free. Verification is automatic.

items.question: How much does it cost?
items.answer: Registration is free for associations and donors. Lien commun charges a 2.5% commission on each donation to fund the platform and blockchain fees.

items.question: Is the data secure?
items.answer: Yes. Personal data is stored encrypted and GDPR compliant. Only transaction proofs are public on the blockchain (without personal data).

architecture.title: Architecture & fund flow
architecture.description: Every donation is tracked end-to-end. Blockchain technology serves as a proof ledger, but remains invisible to end users.

steps.title: 1. Receiving the donation in euros
steps.text: The donor gives in euros through the platform. Zero friction, zero crypto jargon.

steps.title: 2. Conversion to EURCV
steps.text: Funds are converted to euro stablecoin (EURCV) via our institutional partner, ensuring compliance and auditability.

steps.title: 3. On-chain transfer to the association
steps.text: EURCV tokens are transferred to the association's wallet. Every movement is recorded on the blockchain.

steps.title: 4. Allocation & expenses
steps.text: The association distributes funds among its members. Every payment is tracked, with EURCV → EUR reconversion for bank transfers.

steps.title: 5. Proofs & NFT tax receipt
steps.text: At each step, a proof is recorded on-chain. The donor receives their tax receipt as an NFT, accessible at any time.
